title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Previewing Monday's four-game slate
content: Two series begin, while it's Game 2 for Blues-Jets and Stars-Avs. Here are the key storylines in each.

title: NCAA floats rules for direct payments to players
content: The NCAA proposed deleting 153 rules from its handbook, a move that will allow schools to share financial benefits directly with players.

title: Kraken change course, fire Bylsma after 1 season
content: The Kraken are seeking their third head coach in as many seasons after firing Dan Bylsma. More moves are expected, including Ron Francis to president and Jason Botterill to GM.

title: Bucks upgrade Lillard to questionable for Game 2
content: Milwaukee Bucks star Damian Lillard has been upgraded to questionable for Tuesday's Game 2 against the Indiana Pacers, the team announced on Monday.

title: Ex-Duke commit Henderson joins Lucas in Miami
content: ESPN 100 senior Shelton Henderson, who decommitted from Duke last week, announced his commitment to Miami on Monday.

title: Braves put P Strider on IL with hamstring strain
content: The Atlanta Braves have placed right-hander Spencer Strider on the 15-day injured list with a strained right hamstring. The move is retroactive to April 18.

title: A's to call up 2024 No. 4 pick Kurtz, sources say
content: The Athletics are calling up power-hitting first baseman Nick Kurtz after only 32 minor league games, sources told ESPN.

title: Hawks promote Saleh to GM after firing Fields
content: The Atlanta Hawks fired general manager Landry Fields on Monday and promoted Onsi Saleh to fill the position.

title: Buehler stays at hotel to avoid marathon hassles
content: Instead of navigating road closures along the Boston Marathon route, Red Sox pitcher Walker Buehler instead took his family to a hotel prior to his Monday morning start.

title: 'Completely separate and at odds': The divisions and chaos that led to the end of the Luka Doncic era in Dallas
content: Doncic's time in Dallas ended with a shocking trade on Feb. 2, but the beginning of the end dates to the summer of 2023.

title: Why Josh Hart -- and his wide-open 3s -- could be the Knicks' playoff key
content: Few guards got more space to shoot this season than Josh Hart. Making playoff defenses pay for it could fuel a Knicks run.

title: How Mikko Rantanen impacts the Stars' Stanley Cup hopes -- in 2025 and well beyond
content: Long a draft-and-develop team, the trade signaled a philosophical shift, with aftershocks still to come.

title: 'Football is a chess game': How Abdul Carter rose to the top of NFL draft boards amid position change
content: After earning Penn State's famed No. 11 jersey, how has Abdul Carter positioned himself to be a top-5 pick?

title: Marcus Rashford at a crossroads: Can he star at Man United again, or must he leave?
content: Marcus Rashford's options are clear this summer -- fight his way back at Man United, try to join Aston Villa permanently or start somewhere new -- but how he got here depends on whom you ask.

title: Leeds, Burnley win, clinch Premier League return
content: Leeds United and Burnley have been promoted to the Premier League after Scott Parker's side beat third-placed Sheffield United on Monday.

title: Alonso has 'gentleman's agreement' to exit Bayer
content: Bayer Leverkusen's CEO has said the club has a "gentleman's agreement" with Xabi Alonso that means he could take over at Real Madrid or Liverpool.

title: Wrexham edge closer to promotion with key win
content: Wrexham climbed back into the automatic promotion spots in League 1 with a crucial 2-1 win over Blackpool on Monday.

title: Italian soccer pauses as Pope Francis dies at 88
content: Monday's Serie A fixtures have been postponed following the death of Pope Francis, the Italian league has announced.

title: Laureus Awards: Yamal wins breakthrough award
content: Lamine Yamal won the world breakthrough of the year award at the 2025 Laureus World Sports Awards ceremony in Madrid on Monday.

title: Guardiola talks up Man City-Villa as a 'final'
content: Pep Guardiola has branded Manchester City's clash with Aston Villa as "a final" in the race for the Champions League and called on the club's fans to help them against Unai Emery's side.

title: Leicester relegated from PL after loss to Liverpool
content: Leicester City have been condemned to an immediate return to the Championship after their relegation from the Premier League was confirmed with a defeat to Liverpool on Sunday.

title: TAA silent on Madrid links after 'special' winner
content: Liverpool defender Trent Alexander-Arnold remained tight-lipped on his future at Anfield amid continued links to Real Madrid, although he added that Sunday's winner over Leicester City would always be "special."

title: Should Trent Alexander-Arnold think twice about leaving Liverpool for Real Madrid?
content: Trent Alexander-Arnold has a big decision to make: sign a new deal at Liverpool this summer or leave for (we think) Real Madrid. Considering recent trends at both teams, he should reconsider joining Los Blancos.

title: A win away from the title, Liverpool coronation begins at Leicester
content: Liverpool's fans were already celebrating the title in the win at Leicester. The team itself will soon join in.

title: Drivers, teams who need a reset after F1's first five races
content: It's been a whirlwind to start the F1 season, five races in six weekends, and these names could use a breather.

title: WrestleMania 41 Night 2 results: Cena makes history, beats Rhodes for WWE Undisputed title
content: The next chapter of John Cena's farewell tour kicks off with the WWE Universal championship around his waist. Here are the best moments from WrestleMania 41 Night 2.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Is Charlotte a threat to league's best?
content: After beating impressive San Diego, Charlotte is approaching the summit of ESPN's latest MLS Power Rankings.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: KC, Spirit leapfrog Orlando at the top
content: Orlando's first defeat of 2025 cost the Pride, who fell behind KC and Washington in our latest rankings.

title: OU conquers '24 demons, reclaims gymnastics title
content: Fueled by last season's stunning early exit, Oklahoma reclaimed its place atop the college gymnastics world.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool turn to Atalanta's Lookman
content: Liverpool have turned their attention to Atalanta winger Ademola Lookman. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: When Canada's Conservative Party Went From A Majority To Just 2 Seats
content: Canada's political script took a dramatic turn in early 2025, pushing the nation towards an unexpected snap election in April - months ahead of the scheduled October timeline.

title: "Great Leader": JD Vance Lauds PM Modi During His India Visit
content: United States Vice President JD Vance on Monday said it was an "honour" to meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi and called the PM a "great leader" on the first day of his India visit.

title: Trump To Attend Pope Francis' Funeral In Rome
content: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he will attend Pope Francis' funeral in Rome. "Melania and I will be going to the funeral of Pope Francis, in Rome," Trump said on Truth Social.

title: US Urges Curb Of Google's Search Dominance As AI Looms
content: US government attorneys urged a federal judge Monday to make Google spin off its Chrome browser, arguing artificial intelligence is poised to ramp up the tech giant's online search dominance.

title: Pierre Poilievre: Journey From Being A Paper Boy To Canada's PM-Candidate
content: Pierre Poilievre, the combative Conservative leader known for his fiery speeches, is closer than ever to the Prime Minister's Office. As Canada preps for a federal election on April 28, Poilievre finds himself in a two-way showdown with Mark Carney.

title: Mark Carney: Canadian Banker-Turned-PM Betting It All On A Snap Election
content: Mark Carney was once appointed as governor of the Bank of England - the first time a non-British citizen was chosen for the role

title: "Ready For Any Conversation": Zelensky On Putin's Peace Talks With Ukraine
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Monday that Russia needed to give a "clear answer" about whether it would accept a ceasefire on striking civilian targets, a proposal that Moscow said it would "analyse".

title: Liberals Surge Past Conservatives Days Before Canada Votes For New PM
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney has ensured that his party - the Liberal Party of Canada - has come from behind and taken the lead just a week ahead of the parliamentary election in Canada, opinion polls suggest.

title: Security Tightened In Agra Ahead of US Vice President JD Vance's Arrival
content: US Vice President JD Vance will visit the Taj Mahal during his visit to Agra on Wednesday, for which security has been tightened across the city, a police official said.

title: Pope Francis Death Highlights: Pontiff Died Of Heart Stroke, Says Vatican
content: Pope Francis Death News: Pope Francis, the leader of 1.4 billion Catholics in the world since March 2013, died on Easter Monday at the age of 88 after battling various ailments, the Vatican said.

title: Top Court Raps Petitioner Over "Unsubstantiated" Plea On Bengal Violence
content: The Supreme Court on Monday pulled up a petitioner for his "unsubstantiated" claims in a PIL seeking a court-monitored probe into the violence in West Bengal over the Waqf (Amendment) Act.

title: Pope Francis Died Of Stroke And Subsequent Heart Failure, Says Vatican
content: Pope Francis died Monday at age 88. History's first Latin American pontiff charmed the world with his humble style and concern for the poor but alienated many conservatives with critiques of capitalism and climate change.

title: List Of 15 Potential Candidates Who Could Be The Successor To Pope Francis
content: Whether diplomats, theologians, mediators or Vatican insiders, here are 15 cardinals who are among the potential favourites to become the next pope, known as the "papabili", divided by region.

title: Hindu Temple "Vandalised" With Pro-Khalistan Graffiti In Canada
content: A temple in Canada's Surrey has been defaced by vandals with pro-Khalistan graffiti at its entrance and the pillars, authorities said.

title: Biker, Assaulted By "Drunk" Men, Traced Accused On Instagram Using AI tools
content: What could have been a fun breakfast ride turned into a nightmare for a group of eleven bikers in Gurugram after they were forced to stop by allegedly drunk men who beat them up and damaged their luxury bikes.

title: India Announces 3-Day State Mourning In Honour Of Pope Francis
content: The government on Monday announced a three-day state mourning as a mark of respect on the passing away of Pope Francis.

title: Chennai's First AC Local Train: Boon For Some, Bane For Others
content: Chennai's first air-conditioned (AC) suburban train, which rolled out on Saturday, has come as a boon for several commuters during peak hours as the city battles the sweltering heat due to rising temperatures.

title: How AI Cameras Warn Villagers About Presence Of Snow Leopards In PoK
content: The World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) and Lahore University of Management Sciences (LUMS) have developed artificial intelligence (AI)-powered cameras to detect snow leopards and alert villagers to avoid the loss of livestock.

title: "Thought Will Lose Her": 2-Year-Old Girl's Parents Thank Assam Rifles' Swift Rescue, Medical Aid In Manipur
content: A two-year-old girl from a poorly connected remote village in Manipur's Kamjong district was rescued and airlifted by the Assam Rifles on Monday, a statement said.

title: 30 Kiiled, Dozens Wounded In Paramillitary Shelling In Sudan: Report
content: Paramilitary shelling on Sudan's besieged city of El-Fasher, in the western region of Darfur, killed more than 30 civilians and wounded dozens more, activists said on Monday.

title: A conclave & smoke signals: How the next Pope will be chosen
content: Pope Francis, at the age of 88, passed away at 7:35 am, as announced by the Vatican. Cardinal Kevin Farrell confirmed his passing, noting his dedication to the Church and its vulnerable members. The College of Cardinals, consisting of 115 eligible members, will convene in Rome for a secret conclave to elect his successor, following centuries-old traditions.

title: Int'l students stuck in legal limbo but US downplays SEVIS impact
content: Legal challenges are mounting against US agencies for terminating international students' SEVIS records, with courts increasingly granting temporary restraining orders. Immigration attorneys are discussing the agencies' attempts to downplay the irreparable harm caused to students.

title: Russia open to peace talks? Putin proposes bilateral 'negotiations'
content: Amidst ongoing conflict, Russian President Vladimir Putin has signaled a readiness for direct peace talks with Ukraine, a shift welcomed by Washington. This comes after a brief Easter ceasefire, marred by mutual accusations of violations. Ukraine's President Zelenskyy, while skeptical, is sending a delegation to London for discussions with Western allies.

title: Ex-DGP murder case: Wife arrested, claims domestic violence was reason
content: The wife of former Karnataka DGP Om Prakash, Pallavi, has been arrested in connection with his murder, following a complaint filed by their son, Kartikesh. Kartikesh suspected his mother and sister's involvement, alleging previous threats from his mother. Pallavi reportedly confessed to the crime, citing domestic violence as the motive.

title: George Soros' son wishes Happy Easter, Elon Musk responds: You ...
content: A brief exchange on X between Alex Soros and Elon Musk has sparked intrigue, given their families' history of public disagreements. It began when Alex Soros shared Easter greetings, to which Musk responded with, “Um … you too”.

title: Trump tariffs push Chinese giants to bow to India's terms
content: Amidst escalating trade tensions with the US, fueled by Trump's tariffs, China is seeking new markets, particularly India. Despite past border clashes and investment restrictions, Chinese companies are now showing flexibility, accepting minority stakes and technology transfers to access India's growing market and potentially bypass US tariffs through Indian manufacturing.

title: IPL: Gill-Sudharsan stand sets up GT's win as KKR falter on slow Eden track
content: Gujarat Titans defeated Kolkata Knight Riders by 39 runs, propelled by a strong 114-run opening partnership between Shubman Gill (90) and Sai Sudharsan (52). KKR struggled to chase the 199-run target, managing only 159/8, with Ajinkya Rahane's 50 being the lone bright spot. GT's spinners, led by Rashid Khan, effectively stifled KKR's batting lineup, securing a comfortable victory.

title: PM Modi-VP Vance hold bilateral talks: Key takeaways
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and US Vice President JD Vance convened to discuss trade, defence, technology, and global issues. Both leaders assessed the progress in India-US cooperation, anticipating a mutually beneficial trade agreement. PM Modi conveyed greetings to President Trump, expressing anticipation for his visit to India later this year.

title: When LinkedIn co-founder told employees: Go home, have dinner with family then…
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman believes work-life balance is incompatible with startup success, advocating for a relentless work ethic. He argues that those prioritizing balance are not fully committed to winning, emphasizing the intense demands of the startup environment. Hoffman points to the financial rewards reaped by early LinkedIn employees as justification for his demanding approach.

title: 'You can't be complacent': Former Australian captain warns Rohit Sharma
content: Australian legend Steve Waugh has urged Rohit Sharma to introspect about his commitment to Indian cricket and captaincy, especially with the England Test series looming. Waugh emphasised the importance of Test cricket's survival amidst the T20 rise and opposed a two-tier World Test Championship (WTC) format, fearing it would widen the gap between cricketing nations.

title: Bureaucracy must be ‘active facilitator’ of growth: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi emphasized the crucial role of bureaucracy in seizing global opportunities for India's growth. He urged civil servants to transition from regulators to active facilitators, ensuring comprehensive and inclusive development.

title: IPL Points Table: Latest standings after KKR vs GT at Eden Gardens
content: Gujarat Titans defeated Kolkata Knight Riders by 39 runs, strengthening their position at the top of the IPL points table. Shubman Gill's impressive 90 and B Sai Sudharsan's 52 powered GT to 198/3. KKR's Ajinkya Rahane scored a half-century, but a middle-order collapse and Prasidh Krishna's late strikes sealed GT's victory.

title: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy makes a 'promise', says that I understand why, I mean ...
content: Amidst escalating tariffs imposed by the Trump administration, Amazon is navigating challenges to shield consumers from rising costs. CEO Andy Jassy acknowledges the strain on businesses, anticipating price increases from third-party sellers. Amazon is strategically mitigating impact through bulk purchases and renegotiated contracts, while observing early signs of consumer stockpiling in response to expected price hikes.

title: 'Would be killed like your father': Baba Siddique's son receives death threat
content: NCP leader Zeeshan Siddique has received a death threat via email, Mumbai Police reported. The email ominously warned Zeeshan would meet the same fate as his father, Baba Siddique, and demanded a ransom of Rs 10 crore.

title: India imposes 12% duty on steel products to curb unwanted imports
content: To shield its steel industry from a surge in inexpensive imports, the Indian government has implemented a 12% safeguard duty on specific alloy and non-alloy steel flat products. This action, welcomed by the Union Minister, aims to alleviate pressure on domestic manufacturers, particularly SMEs, facing market distortions due to increased foreign steel inflows.

title: After hair dryer & trimmer, PSL team gifts gold-plated iPhone to star bowler
content: Lahore Qalandars captain Shaheen Shah Afridi received a customised 24-carat gold-plated iPhone 16 Pro, creating buzz and envy within the team. This extravagant gift followed Karachi Kings' quirky rewards to their players. The Lahore Qalandars shared an unboxing video on social media, showcasing Afridi's surprised reaction and sparking playful jealousy from teammates like Haris Rauf.

title: Happy Earth Day 2025: 50 wishes, quotes and more to raise awareness
content: Earth Day, born from a growing environmental awareness sparked by Rachel Carson's 'Silent Spring,' unites over a billion people annually to address critical issues like climate change and pollution. While celebrating the planet's gifts, it emphasizes the urgent need for action, urging individuals to make meaningful choices towards a sustainable future.

title: Luis Arraez gives update on his current health after Sunday's accident
content: San Diego Padres' Luis Arraez was hospitalized after a collision with Houston Astros' Mauricio Dubon during Sunday's game, causing concern among fans. Arraez, conscious and stable, was taken to Houston Methodist Hospital for evaluation. He later updated fans via Instagram, expressing gratitude for the support and assuring everyone of his well-being.

title: Tahawwur Rana seeks court permission to speak with family
content: Tahawwur Hussain Rana, accused in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, has petitioned a Delhi court for permission to communicate with his family. The Patiala Court has issued a notice to the NIA regarding Rana's plea, with a hearing scheduled for April 23. Rana, considered a key conspirator and aide to David Headley, is currently in custody.

title: What was Pope Francis' take on homosexuality, abortion?
content: Pope Francis, who passed away on Monday, leaves behind a legacy of both upholding and altering Catholic Church teachings. He maintained the church's stance against abortion but advocated for spiritual support for women who had them. While denouncing economic systems that prioritize money, he defended his views as aligned with the Gospel.

title: Shannon Sharpe facing allegations of assault, sexual battery, and manipulation
content: Shannon Sharpe is facing a shocking lawsuit alleging abuse, sexual assault, and emotional manipulation. Filed by a woman under the pseudonym "Jane Doe," the complaint claims Sharpe secretly recorded their encounters, coerced her with his celebrity status, and ignored boundaries. The lawsuit seeks $50 million in damages, raising serious questions about power and accountability in celebrity culture.

title: Watch: KL Rahul returns to 'old home' Ekana stadium as DC face LSG
content: KL Rahul is set to play against Lucknow Super Giants in Lucknow. This IPL 2025 match is important for both Delhi Capitals and LSG. Rahul, now with Delhi, previously captained Lucknow. He has been in good form this season. Both teams are currently tied with 10 points. The match could significantly impact the points table standings.

title: Trump slams Fed's Powell again as US stocks tumble
content: US stocks plummeted amid trade war anxieties fueled by President Trump's policies and Federal Reserve criticism, triggering investor flight. The Dow Jones, Nasdaq, and S&P 500 experienced significant declines, while the VIX surged, reflecting heightened market volatility. Gold prices rose as investors sought safe-haven assets, while the US dollar weakened against major currencies.

title: Shubhangi Atre’s ex husband Piyush Poorey passes away
content: Actress Shubhangi Atre is mourning the loss of her former husband, Piyush Poorey, who passed away on Saturday after battling liver cirrhosis. The couple, married for 22 years, had finalized their divorce on February 5th. While they were reportedly not in contact, Shubhangi is deeply saddened by the news. Acknowledging the difficult time, she has requested space to grieve.

title: Anthony Stolarz wins Don Cherry's wild card before Toronto Maple Leafs opener
content: Don Cherry, a seasoned NHL commentator, has predicted that goalie Anthony Stolarz could be the Toronto Maple Leafs' 'ace in the hole' or their worst weakness. The pressure-packed atmosphere surrounding the game is growing, especially as the Leafs prepare to host the Ottawa Senators. Cherry believes Stolarz is the man to start, but with a condition. Stolarz has had a bumpy NHL path since 2012 but now has the opportunity to prove himself in Toronto.

title: Rohit Sharma thanks Abhishek Nayar after match-winning knock for MI
content: Following his impressive innings in the IPL, Rohit Sharma expressed gratitude to Abhishek Nayar, his long-time friend and mentor, after Nayar's recent departure as the national team's assistant coach. Despite the termination, Nayar has quickly rejoined the Kolkata Knight Riders, where his return could prove significant, as acknowledged by players like KL Rahul for his invaluable support.

title: 'Hindus threatened at gunpoint': BJP's big claims on Murshidabad violence
content: The BJP has alleged that Hindus in Murshidabad were threatened at gunpoint and forced to chant Islamic slogans during recent violence. Union minister Sukanta Majumdar claims these incidents foreshadow a grim future for Hindus across West Bengal. The BJP IT department also shared a video depicting robbery and arson, highlighting the plight of a family allegedly targeted during the unrest.

title: Lion kills 14-year-old girl in Nairobi in presence of another teenager
content: In a tragic incident near Nairobi National Park, a 14-year-old girl was killed by a lion, prompting a search operation by the Kenya Wildlife Service (KWS). Rangers discovered the girl's body near the Mbagathi River, and a trap has been set for the lion. Separately, a 54-year-old man was killed by an elephant in Nyeri County.

title: 'Bargaining with tiger for its skin': China's stark warning to US
content: China has strongly condemned growing US pressure on its trading partners, pledging to retaliate against actions harming its interests. Washington is reportedly urging allies to reduce trade with Beijing for tariff exemptions, which China views as coercive. Beijing insists on equality in trade talks and warns against protectionism, emphasizing its resolve to defend its rights amidst escalating tariffs.

title: How a video call became first clue in murder of ex-K'taka DGP Om Prakash
content: Former Karnataka police chief Om Prakash was fatally stabbed by his wife, Pallavi, at their HSR Layout residence following a heated argument. Pallavi, who reportedly has schizophrenia, attacked Prakash with chili powder and then inflicted multiple knife wounds. The homicide stemmed from ongoing disputes, including a property disagreement, and authorities are investigating Pallavi's mental state.

title: Pope Francis' India connection: Canonisations, cardinals & visit that wasn’t
content: Pope Francis passing marked the end of a deep relationship with India, characterized by spiritual milestones and recognition of Indian cardinals. Despite his desire, a papal visit never materialized, though he strengthened ties with the Catholic community. Landmark canonizations, including the first Indian layperson declared a saint, brought joy, while liturgical uniformity sparked discord within the Syro-Malabar Church.

title: Road rage shocker: IAF officer, wife attacked by biker in Bengaluru
content: In Bengaluru, an Indian Air Force officer, Wing Commander Aditya Bose, and his wife, Squadron Leader Madhumita, were allegedly assaulted on Sunday evening. According to reports, a biker tailed their car, verbally abused them, and attacked Wing Commander Bose with a key, causing a head injury. The biker further threw a stone, hitting Bose again.

title: Couple caught having sex inside Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport bus
content: A young couple was filmed engaging in sexual activity on a Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport bus, prompting swift action from authorities after the video circulated online. The incident occurred on a bus traveling from Panvel to Kalyan, leading to departmental proceedings against the conductor for failing to intervene. Officials have condemned the act as vulgar and unacceptable in public transport.

title: 'NHL wants Toronto to win': Penalties in Ottawa Senators vs Toronto Maple Leafs
content: Former ice hockey player P. K. Subban criticised a penalty called during the Ottawa Senators versus Toronto Maple Leafs game. He felt the call was soft and changed the game's momentum. Fans online agreed with Subban. Many believe the referees favor Toronto. Some fans think the league wants Toronto to win. Others stated the penalty was a textbook boarding.

title: Son of murdered ex-K'taka DGP reveals chilling threats by mother, sister
content: Former Karnataka DGP Om Prakash was allegedly murdered by his wife Pallavi and daughter Kriti at their HSR Layout home. His son Kartikesh filed a complaint, citing prior threats. Om Prakash was found with fatal injuries. Both accused have been arrested, and further investigation is ongoing to uncover the motive.

title: IPL 2025: RR captain Sanju Samson to miss next match against RCB too
content: Rajasthan Royals captain Sanju Samson will miss the upcoming match against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. He is recovering from a side strain injury sustained during a previous game. Samson is currently at the team's home base undergoing rehab. The team management is closely monitoring his progress. His return to action will be decided on a game-by-game basis.

title: Pope Francis dies: World leaders mourn passing away of 'beacon of hope'
content: Pope Francis, the first Jesuit and non-European pontiff in over 1,200 years, passed away on Easter Monday at the age of 88. His papacy, which began in 2013, was defined by his focus on mercy, inclusiveness, and environmental concerns. World leaders are mourning the loss of a figure who championed justice and compassion, while the Vatican prepares for the election of a new pope.

title: Who is Zikra? 'Lady Don' behind Seelampur teen’s murder was grooming gangs of minors
content: Zikra, a self-proclaimed 'Lady Don' with ties to a gangster's family, is implicated in the murder of a 17-year-old. Arrested previously for Arms Act violations and social media displays of firearms, she allegedly groomed a gang of minors for criminal activities. Nine individuals, including two minors and the main accused, Sahil, have been apprehended.

title: Women forced to walk miles in 44°C heat to fetch drinking water in Yavatmal
content: Across Vidarbha, Yavatmal's Phanse Pardhi settlements face a severe water crisis as temperatures soar. Women risk their lives daily, walking kilometers to fetch water from uncovered wells due to the failure of government schemes and lack of infrastructure. Classified as encroachments, these communities are excluded from basic amenities, highlighting the urgent need for government intervention to alleviate their suffering.

title: SC confirms probe against Ranveer Allahbadia is complete
content: The Supreme Court has confirmed the completion of the investigation into YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia, also known as BeerBiceps, regarding FIRs filed over controversial remarks on 'India's Got Latent.' A hearing is scheduled for April 28 to consider Allahbadia’s plea for his passport's return, with a chargesheet expected soon from Maharashtra police. The court had previously granted permission for him to resume his podcast under certain content restrictions.

title: Meghan accused of copying author’s work for show
content: Meghan Markle faces plagiarism accusations as British author Mel Elliott claims striking similarities between Markle's shelved animated series 'Pearl' and her 'Pearl Power' children's books. Elliott sent legal notices to Archewell, alleging copyright infringement, but received no response. This isn't the first time Markle's projects have been compared to existing works, raising concerns about originality.

title: European soccer review: Real Madrid still in title race, plus much more
content: the laLiga title race is nearly officially over, but the race for european places is as competitive as ever . in the Bundesliga, Germany's last remaining clubs were knocked out of european competition, but Bayern Munich returned to some sense of normalcy by dismantling a relative minnow .

title: What to watch in Knicks-Pistons Game 2 -- and what's next for every East series
content: the 2025 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . the new york Knicks are looking to take a 2-0 series lead on the young Detroit Pistons after capturing Game 1 with a late 21-0 run .

title: Golden State's clutch win and OKC's big statement put the West on notice
content: the 2024-25 playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . the no. 1 seed Oklahoma City Thunder clobber the 8-seed Memphis Grizzlies by 51 points for the fifth-largest margin of victory in NBA history .

title: Body of a youth found in washroom of Fazilka hospital, SMO claims drug overdose
content: Dinesh Sharma, co-founder, APCA (Academy of Pastry and Culinary Arts) 8 underrated South Indian rice dishes perfect for a light and healthy dinner Tamannaah Bhatia's risque fashion is a mood Enchanting snaps of Helly Shah Top 5 zodiac signs that make love feel magical Baby girl names that mean sunshine How to avoid a toxic atmosphere at work (and thrive instead!) ​10 insects that are as colourful as birds ​ 10 lessons from 'The Secret' by Rhonda Byrne that only the select few could understand How to start your first balcony garden in 10 simple steps

title: College baseball Week 10: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: we're getting down to crunch time for some teams to prove themselves . the biggest riser was Vanderbilt, which jumped up 10 spots after sweeping Georgia . Ole Miss dropped 12 spots to no. 23 in the ranking this week after losing a road series to south Carolina .

title: Petition dismissed after Nashik dargah withdraws it from the Supreme Court
content: The dargah was demolished by the municipal corporation a few days ago, hours before the apex court stayed its demolition

title: Calcutta University scholars travel to Sundarbans village to save language
content: They are translating into the English a novel about char lands, river erosion, loss of land, and the vulnerability of people’s life there, written by a local in a tribal language called Sadri

title: First stop Akshardham Temple for Vances, U.S. VP says his 'kids, in particular, loved it'
content: “A carved wooden elephant, a model of the Delhi Akshardham Temple and children’s books were gifted to the family”

title: Sainthoods, Cardinal elevation: a papacy marked by a keen engagement with India
content: Francis, who was the first non-European Pope in nearly 1,300 years, died on Easter Monday. He was 88. The Pope was diagnosed with double pneumonia

title: ‘Wasn’t consulted’: Maharashtra language panel chief on Hindi row
content: The committee has already written a letter to Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis advising to revoke the decision

title: HCA cannot take any financial decisions: HC interim direction
content: The interim direction was passed in a writ petition filed by the Telangana Cricket Association, levelling serious allegations against HCA, accusing its office bearers of indulging in corruption

title: SNDP: 13 components from Phase-I remain non-starters within and outside Hyderabad
content: Officials cite various reasons ranging from lack of right of way and difficulties in utility shifting

title: W.B. school recruitment crisis: fresh protests erupt outside WBSSC office over demand of list of ‘tainted’ and ‘untainted’ candidates
content: Hundreds of teachers laid siege to the Commission’s office, demanding the immediate publication of the list and the resignation of the Education Minister and the WBSSC Chairperson, after the agency missed the promised deadline.

title: Final-year IIT Kharagpur student found dead in hostel
content: Following the second unnatural student death at IIT Kharagpur this year, the Institute’s Teachers’ Association is demanding the immediate appointment of a permanent director.

title: Two linked with father-son murder in Murshidabad arrested in Odisha
content: Six other Murshidabad men who had allegedly participated in the violence during the protests against the Waqf Act were detained in Jharsuguda

title: ED carrying on vendetta against Congress: Chidambaram on National Herald case
content: Congress leader P. Chidambaram said there was no case since there was no transaction of money and, therefore, no proceeds of crime nor any money laundering.

title: Prashant Kishor demands White Paper on caste-based survey; ‘unfulfilled promises’
content: Mr. Kishor asserted that states like Andhra Pradesh, which started their land survey after Bihar, have digitized 80% of the land so far, but Bihar has only digitized 20%.

title: National Herald case a political conspiracy: Kanhaiya Kumar
content: ‘No one is speaking about the finances of BJP and RSS. From where are they getting the money to build their plush offices in every city?’

title: Quraishi slams Dubey; says for some, religious identities are staple to forward hateful politics
content: Nishikant Dubey's barb at the former CEC came a day after his vitriolic attack on the Supreme Court and Chief Justice of Sanjiv Khanna, blaming the CJI for causing "civil wars" in India.

title: Gold was being smuggled to India after declaring it to be taken either to Geneva or Bangkok: DRI tells Karnataka High Court
content: Ranya was booking tickets both to Geneva or Bangkok but travelling to India without cancelling other ticket

title: Liquor scam: SIT police arrests Kasireddy Rajasekhar Reddy at RGIA airport in Hyderabad
content: A team of police are shifting Kasireddy to Vijayawada, and will produce him in the court, according to a senior police officer

title: Jammu-Srinagar National Highway remains blocked for second day
content: It will take around three days to restore traffic on Jammu-Srinagar highway, says CM; Jammu Divisional Commissioner says departments instructed to expedite restoration of public utilities

title: Private schools warned against conducting tests, interviews for students and parents for admission
content: Commissioner of Public Instruction in a circular says 50% seats should be mandatorily reserved for girls in all co-educational schools

title: BJP accuses Rahul Gandhi of being a ‘traitor’ over his remarks on EC
content: Slamming the former Congress president, BJP MP Sambit Patra says Mr. Gandhi is a ‘politically unfit person’ and that such an individual always ‘takes the crutches of false allegations’ to prove that he is a leader

title: SC junks students’ plea over attempts for JEE-Advanced 2025 exam
content: The plea claimed the petitioners were aggrieved by the "abrupt and arbitrary policy reversal" regarding the eligibility criteria for JEE-Advanced 2025 by the Joint Admission Board

title: PM Modi, U.S. Vice-President Vance see progress in bilateral trade talks
content: PM reviews ties with U.S. Vice-President, hosts his family for dinner; no mention of tariff and visa revocation issues in PMO statement; no new agreements announced as earlier expected

title: BJP’s Madhav Bhandari sparks controversy over 26/11 remarks, later issues clarification
content: In remarks that triggered widespread outrage, Bhandari claimed that the 26/11 Mumbai terror attack would not have been possible without the involvement of individuals who had influence over the local administration

title: Bihar Mahagathbandhan’s rank and file to meet
content: Coinciding with Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Madhubani visit on April 24, the Opposition alliance’s leadership has planned a two-day meeting

title: Adityanath backing pro-monarchy movement in Nepal: CPN-Maoist-Centre’s Matrika Prasad Yadav
content: CPN-Maoist-Centre plans to arrest former king Gyanendra for supporting pro-monarchy protests, accusing UP CM of interference.

title: Civil services should get credit for smooth transfer of power: Cabinet Secretary
content: Cabinet Secretary T.V. Somanathan bats for lateral entry, says even corrupt IAS officers get high ranking in online appraisal system

title: FMGs’ worry grows as NEET PG exam application date nears
content: Permanent or Temporary Registration, which is mandatory for them to apply for the exam, has been elusive for them for various reasons

title: Traffic chaos near toll plazas ruins smooth Bengaluru–Mysuru highway experience
content: Many are calling for immediate action from NHAI, including better toll management, functional Fastag sensors, and contingency measures like opening gates during peak congestion to prevent further disruption.

title: EPFO adds 7.39 lakh new members in February
content: Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Gujarat, Haryana, Delhi, Telangana and Uttar Pradesh added more than 5% of the total net payroll during the month

title: Probe on into missing of POCSO case survivor, child from shelter home in Kozhikode
content: The girl and her child had recently been brought to Shakti Sadan, an integrated relief and rehabilitation home for women in distress

title: Farmers’ outfits raise call to burn effigies of Modi, Trump, Vance as mark of protest against trade treaty
content: U.S. wants unregulated access for its agribusiness corporations to operate in India and this will hit the peasants hard, says Samyukt Kisan Morcha

title: CISF takes over security at Aizawl airport
content: This will be the Central Industrial Security Force’s first unit stationed in Mizoram, and the 69th civilian airport under its protection

title: Nine days of mourning for Pope Francis, says Catholic Bishops’ Conference of India
content: CBCI and Chavara Cultural Centre Delhi organise condolence meeting that leaders from various faiths, diplomats, clergy, and public figures attend.

title: Telangana Rythu Mahotsavam in Nizamabad assures desilting of Nizamsagar and SRSP soon
content: Government was fully equipped for the ongoing Rabi 2024–25 paddy procurement, with all necessary infrastructure, in place across the State, says Minister for Irrigation

title: Kerala govt. hikes payment for daily wage and contract workers
content: Appointees will have to give an affidavit that he/she will not make any claims for regularisation of employment, as per norms issued by the Finance dept.

title: Anvar’s UDF entry hits roadblock amid resistance from allies
content: Front constituents are apparently willing to collaborate with the former MLA for the Nilambur byelection, but they are hesitant to formally include him in the front. They fear that a formal entry into the UDF will lend legitimacy to him and all his past deeds

title: Blasting row at Upper Sengulam power project: KSEB to seek advice from Central Institute of Mining and Fuel Research
content: Blasting operations for constructing a tunnel for the hydel project were halted on February 17 after local residents raised concerns regarding safety

title: Court to pronounce sentence in Ambalamukku Vineetha murder case on April 24; prosecution seeks death penalty
content: District Collector, District Police Chief state accused pose serious threat to society, shows minimal potential for reformation

title: Bihar Congress suspends party’s Buxar district president for poor turnout at Kharge’s rally
content: About 10,000 chairs had been arranged for the ‘Jai Bapu, Jai Bhim, Jai Samvidhan’ rally; a video of thousands of empty chairs went viral on social media; the Bihar Assembly election is due to be held later this year

title: Water samples test negative for contamination, situation monitored in Woraiyur, says Tiruchi Corporation
content: A total of 40 special health teams have been deployed in the affected areas to check and monitor the condition of the residents and 15 medical teams have set up camps in the area

title: Should KCR be remembered for pushing Telangana into ₹8 lakh crore debt, Congress asks KTR
content: People have rejected the BRS twice as people realised their misgovernance, only KCR’s family members were happy with the BRS rule, the Congress MP said

title: Farmers’ body opposes transfer of Kovur Sugar factory’s 124-acre land to APIIC
content: Leaders of Sugarcane Farmers’ Association urge all the shareholders, farmers and others to attend a conference to be held at the sugar factory premises on April 24 to discuss an action plan

title: Work on first automatic signalling in Kerala gains pace
content: Approval given for physical works on the Ernakulam-Shoranur stretch. The ₹156.47-crore work is expected to be completed in one-and-a-half years

title: Steps underway to ease Vizianagaram’s water supply shortfall
content: Vizianagaram civic body plans to draw water from Andra reservoir amid supply deficit and rising summer demand

title: Pope Francis had acted decisively in affairs of Syro-Malabar Church
content: Pope Francis chose to directly engage with Islamic leaders, undertaking historic papal visits across the Muslim world, and striving to build bridges of peace and understanding

title: Small arms factory set up by UAE’s Caracal with Megha Group firm ICOMM opened
content: Comprehensive portfolio of advanced weapons under a tech transfer agreement with Caracal to be manufactured at the facility in Hyderabad

title: Farmers seek relief from ‘false cases’ in leopard’s death near Madanapalle
content: Forest officials resorted to arresting their family members without any notice or inquiry, allege farmers

title: Construction of Polavaram project’s ECRF dam commenced parallel to new diaphragm  wall works, says Water Resource Minister Nimmala Rama Naidu
content: ‘The diaphragm wall works worth ₹990 crore are in full swing while ₹1,200 crore has been allocated to complete the Left Main Canal of the project to provide irrigation and drinking water for the North Andhra region, including Visakhapatnam city, for industrial needs’
